CatDescriptText: Hyman Siegel, cab driver, Squirrel Hill and Freeman Martin, machine operator, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "what action, if any, should be taken and by whom, when Negro members of integrated teams refuse to play before segregated crowds?"  Mr. Siegel's answer reads: "If it's going to be segregated, I don't think any of the players should play."  Mr. Martin's answer reads: "If they play on the team, they should go ahead and play anywhere.  There's no use in waiting until they get a game going, and then to start mixing with the integration issue."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Double exposure: Portrait of Hyman Siegel wearing short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing in front of ribbed u-shaped wall and metal railing, Standing man and building; Portrait of Freeman Martin wearing plaid shirt and cap, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
